course.title: Quantum Mechanics for Astrophysics
course.description: Quantum mechanics with applications to atomic and molecular processes important in astronomical environments. Atomic and molecular structure; spectroscopy (selection rules, oscillator strengths, photoionization); scattering theory (elastic, inelastic, approximate methods); line broadening; collision processes (cross sections, rate coefficients) involving electrons, ions, atoms, and molecules.
course.prerequisites: Physics 143a or the equivalent, or permission of instructor.
course.notes: This course offered in alternate years.
